info.brief: Eager Python developer and inquisitive hacker with background in political data and insatiable thirst for technical growth. Prefers elegant solutions to immediate solutions whenever possible; likes working with teams that encourage curiosity and value creativity, and with organizations that prioritize data-driven decision making.

history.summary: Resident tech whiz, data wrangler and tool-builder, administrator of data/tech infrastructure.
highlights: Developed, automated, and maintained a wide array of routine reporting products with the PyData stack and other Python packages and GNU/Linux tools for data munging and pipelining, d3.js and crossfilter.js for web-based reporting front-ends, and a liberal dose of VBA for generating complicated, institutionally-entrenched Excel dashboards.
Found novel solutions to barriers in the acquisition, processing, application, and interaction of new and old datasets by leveraging open-source tools and a relentless hacker ethos.
Handled administration of development and analytics server, Amazon Redshift instance, and Civis Platform.

history.summary: Data guru for dozens of progressive 501(c)(3) and 501(c)(4) non-profits, labor unions, and independent expenditure PACs in Minnesota.
highlights: Made large- and small-scale targeting recommendations based on analysis of modeling, past program and election results, and capacity for electoral, civic engagement, and legislative advocacy campaigns.
Performed analyses of candidate fundraising versus electoral performance to identify vulnerabilities and opportunities in battleground district targeting.

Created web-based dashboards and tools for candidate recruitment, real-time election night predictions at the precinct level, interactive maps of district- and precinct-level modeling, and tracking public and internal polls.
Created individual-level modeling routines to aid in partner base-building work, political targeting, and program evaluation.
Managed all field, targeting, and reporting data for a statewide ballot measure campaign.
Improved data warehousing by centralizing data storage of constituent information in one database for ease-of-access to all staff.
Trained staff and volunteers and created documentation on new and existing data systems and conventions.

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts with Distinction in Engagement

history.title: Bachelor of Arts with Distinction in Engagement
history.summary: Bachelor of Arts with major course of study in philosophy and minor course of study in music. Distinction in Engagement recognizes service in student government at university- and state-level, contributions to student civic engagement efforts, and diversity of academic endeavors, both at alma mater and during an exchange at the University of Reading.
